learning_obj.text: Understand the Principles of Critical Chain

sub_bullets.text: Comprehend the core concepts of CCPM, including its focus on resource dependency and constraint management.
Learn how to create and use buffers to protect project timelines against uncertainties and delays.
Develop skills to allocate resources effectively within the critical chain, reducing multitasking and resource conflicts.

learning_obj.text: Monitor and Control the Critical Chain

sub_bullets.text: Gain proficiency in tracking project progress using CCPM principles and making adjustments to the chain and buffers as needed.

learning_obj.text: Apply CCPM to Improve Project Flow

sub_bullets.text: Understand how to apply CCPM to real-world projects to enhance project completion rates and overall efficiency.

characteristics.text: Buffers added to protect the project schedule from uncertainties and variations in task durations

sub_bullets.text: Added at the end of the project to protect the overall timeline.
Placed where non-critical paths feed into the critical chain to prevent delays from affecting the project.
Ensures resources are available when needed, especially for critical chain tasks.

characteristics.text: Clearly identified timeline for workflow, avoiding multitasking
Allows subteams to reconvene on important objectives requiring additional manpower

benefits.text: Creates good efficiency due to being split up into teams for smaller objectives

sub_bullets.text: Pfizer identified the critical path of drug development processes that were often delayed due to resource constraints or unexpected problems.
Introduced project buffers and feeding buffers to protect key tasks and prevent delays from pushing back the timeline.
Aligned and scheduled resources such as researchers and lab equipment to avoid over-allocation or under-utilization.
Implemented task prioritization using CCPM principles, focusing on tasks that directly impacted the timeline and avoiding unnecessary work.

evaluation.text: Define the critical chain method of management.
What are the pros of using critical chain methodology?
